definition: generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Hurstwood seemed more apathetic than ever.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎比以前更顯得麻木不仁。
是的，監獄讓你麻木不仁。

sentences.english: That the numbed armies of fear cannot destory.
sentences.chinese: 即便是麻木不仁的恐驚之軍也無法摧毀。

sentences.english: I felt ashamed for the callousness of the government in tackling land speculation.
sentences.chinese: 對於政府處理地產投機態度麻木不仁，我引以爲恥。

sentences.english: Once in a while, a tragedy occurs which touches even the most case-hardened heart.
sentences.chinese: 悲劇不時發生，連那些麻木不仁的人們也有所觸動。

sentences.english: Because of unfeeling and obstinacy, my heart will hardly open.
sentences.chinese: 由於麻木不仁和固執，我心將難以敞開。

sentences.english: I've never known anyone as insensitive as Gina.
sentences.chinese: 我從未見過像吉娜那樣麻木不仁的人。

sentences.english: As soon as you thought own love love history, can cry one's heart out, numb.
sentences.chinese: 沵一想到自己旳愛情史，會痛哭流涕，麻木不仁。

sentences.english: Seeing too much violence on television can desensitize people to it.
sentences.chinese: 在電視上看太多暴力，會使人對暴力麻木不仁。

sentences.english: I didn't realize I was being an insensitive clod .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道原來我是這麼一個麻木不仁的笨蛋。

sentences.english: Scream about it. Just don’t go back to being numb.
sentences.chinese: 就是不要再麻木不仁地對待它。

definition: not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to set to one side and ignore (idiom); quite indifferent/cold and uncaring
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
